docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 5 -- The River Plate Regional Conference today set up a permanent office with headquarters in Buenos Aires to watch over the operation of regional agreements, conduct studies and report on measures for keeping the regional...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 5 -- The River Plate Regional Conference today set up a permanent office with headquarters in Buenos Aires to watch over the operation of regional agreements, conduct studies and report on measures for keeping the regional group alive as a vital, functioning organization.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 6 -- The first regional conference of the River Plate countries closed today after signing nine conventions, one recommendation and sixteen resolutions. Members of the Latin-American diplomatic corps enthusiastically...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 6 -- The first regional conference of the River Plate countries closed today after signing nine conventions, one recommendation and sixteen resolutions. Members of the Latin-American diplomatic corps enthusiastically describe the conference as one of the most successful inter-American assemblies ever held.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 6 -- The nomination of John G. Winant, New Hampshire Republican, to be Ambassador to Great Britain was sent to the Senate today by President Roosevelt, together with nine other nominations involving shifts or additional duties for key American diplomats.

docs.snippet: PREDICTIONS that the war would end all interest in pleasure travel appear to have been premature. Discovery that the travel horizon, even with Europe blacked out, is far from circumscribed and still holds exciting adventure has been made apparent by...
docs.lead_paragraph: PREDICTIONS that the war would end all interest in pleasure travel appear to have been premature. Discovery that the travel horizon, even with Europe blacked out, is far from circumscribed and still holds exciting adventure has been made apparent by an increasing number of travelers, travelers pushing out to Hawaii and the Philippines, to Alaska, to the Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico and Panama.

headline.main: RANDOM NOTES FOR TRAVELERS; America Finds New Roads to Explore -- Cruising South on Land -- Spring Trip to Argentina -- Taboga, Once Haunt of Pirates
